column2: Hey there, Would you like to see what's in these files?
Yes!
The files should be there on the desktop - Launch the *Leviathan* app.

Whew, so glad to see –– wait, all the text is encrypted. I *finally* get my research back and now I can't read it!

These files hold some of my research on a mysterious historical hacker known as *Leviathan*. 

*Document 1103* covers Leviathan's takedown of an especially wily AI. But to read it, we need to decrypt it!
Maybe Estelle can help us with this! She's a total genius with ciphers.
Did I hear that someone is having trouble with a cipher?

Estelle! That was fast even for you, thanks for responding so quickly. 

We'd like your eyes on this puzzle - Something tells me you'll be able to help.
Let's see. Mmm hmm. I think I can move this along, I've done a bit of this in my day.
Let's find out what the trouble is. We need to get in there and adjust some settings in the Hacking panel.
Try this key and see if it gets us where we need to go - Flip the App and see if it's locked!
Ah, beautiful.
So, here we are. See that number labeled *Cipher*, in the *Effects panel*? Try changing that and see what happens.
Try any number. Even the wrong guess will give us more information about what we're working with.
Once you try a number, Flip back to see if anything changed.

Aha! Look at the letters in the files - They've changed. They have also changed in *Cipher Output*, as well. Interesting!

This confirms my theory - this is encoded with a rotational cipher, where the letters are shifted over in the alphabet.

For example, if you take the word *CAT* and shift all the letters over one, you get *DBU*.
Maybe the page holds some clues? What can we still see clearly? Just for fun, try counting the cat tails!
This looks like it might be a long, difficult process. Any tips, Estelle?
Ciphers like this one only change letters, not where letters appear in words. I think I see some patterns in the data...
*OCZ* appears many times. If we compare *OCZ* to a common 3-letter word like *THE*, we might find the solution.
Putting *OCZ* into *Cipher Input* and then counting letters until you get *THE* in *Cipher Output* could decode the cipher.
Excellent! That did the trick! Look at all these files.
Hey, check out that sketch at the bottom right. I was wondering if that might be useful.

Ah, yes. What we’re looking at is a *Sidetrack Instruction* called `push`.

Now that's a signature Leviathan move - Removing an obstacle.
Tiiiight! I knew you'd be able to help us with this, Estelle! Thank you!
Amazing. Thank you, Estelle. What does this new instruction do?

It does just what it says. You can use it to move a *Wall* that's blocking you. 

Riley can use it in *Sidetrack* to push *Walls* out of her way. It’s going to be essential in getting her past obstacles.
Well, this is getting very interesting! Why was there a note about Saniel's AI trap in Leviathan's code sketchbooks?
Ada, I think that's something you're going to have to ask Saniel about!

I am totally going to do that. Right now, we've got to get back to Riley!

Come find me in the Clubhouse when you're ready!
Okay, come back when you're ready! Riley still needs our help to get through the maze, so come back soon!
